trans-unit.source: Manages design-time serialization to and from extensible Application Markup Language (XAML) for workflows.

A workflow or activity designer can use <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager> to access services useful to managing design-time serialization processes.

For example, <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager> can be used to create objects, look up types, identify objects, and customize the serialization of particular types.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref> class by using the specified <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> with which to initialize the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref>.
Adds the specified serialization provider to the serialization manager.
<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.AddSerializationProvider%2A> adds a custom serialization provider to the serialization manager.
Serialization providers can provide custom serializers for a particular type of object or set of types of objects.
During serialization, each custom serialization provider is queried to return a serializer for a specific data type, if it can provide one.
The serialization manager uses the custom serializer provided by this method before using the default serializer for a particular type.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider"></xref> to add.
Gets a stack-based, user-defined storage area that is useful for communication between serializers.
Some serializers require information about the context of an object to correctly persist their state.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.Context%2A> enables a serializer to set data about the context of an object that it is serializing to a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack> where another serializer can access it.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.ContextStack"></xref> that contains information about the current object being serialized.
Returns a serializer of the specified type for an object of the specified type.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> for which to retrieve the serializer.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the serializer to retrieve.
The requested serializer, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no appropriate serializer can be located.
Returns a service object of the specified type.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of service object to return.
A service object of type serviceType, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if there is no service object of type serviceType.
Returns a type of the specified name.
The fully-qualified name of the <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to load.
The associated with typeName.
Returns that type associated with the specified XML qualified name.
An XML qualified name is a namespace-qualified local name, in the format of namespace:localname.
Because prefixes are only required when XML is persisted or read, they are irrelevant for <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> objects.
It is the responsibility of the user to ensure the local name does not contain a ":"
The <xref href="System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName"></xref> of the type to load.
The associated with xmlQualifiedName.
xmlQualifiedName contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Returns the XML-qualified name associated with the specified type.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> for which to return the XML-qualified name.
When this method returns, contains the XML prefix for the qualified name or an empty string if no prefix is defined.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The associated with type.
type contains a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).
Gets or sets the assembly that is associated with the current serializer.
The <xref href="System.Reflection.Assembly"></xref> that is associated with the current serializer.
Removes a custom serialization provider from the <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider"></xref> to remove.

This provider must be added using <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.AddSerializationProvider(System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationProvider)"></xref>.
Reports an error in serialization.
`errorInformation` can be of any object type.
If it is an exception, the message of the exception is extracted and reported to the user.
If it is any other type, <xref:System.Object.ToString%2A> is called to display the information to the user.
The error to report.
Gets or sets the serialization manager to use with the current serializer.
The <xref href="System.ComponentModel.Design.Serialization.IDesignerSerializationManager"></xref> to use with the current serializer.
Creates an instance of the specified type and adds it to a collection of named instances.
If `addToContainer` is set to `true`, the object must implement <xref:System.ComponentModel.IComponent> for this to have any effect.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to create.
An that contains the arguments for type.
The name of the object.

This name can be used to access the object later using <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System#ComponentModel#Design#Serialization#IDesignerSerializationManager#GetInstance(System.String)"></xref>.
If a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) is passed, the object is still created but cannot be accessed by name.
`true` to add the object to the design container; otherwise, `false`.
The newly created object.
Returns an instance of a created object of the specified name.

`name` must be set through a prior call to <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23Serialization%23IDesignerSerializationManager%23CreateInstance(System.Type,System.Collections.ICollection,System.String,System.Boolean)?displayProperty=fullName>.
The name of the object to retrieve.
An instance of the object with the given name, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if no object by that name can be found.
Returns the name of the specified object.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> for which to retrieve the name.
The name of the object, or a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic) if the object is unnamed.
Gets a collection of properties that can be serialized with available serializers.
This property can contain an empty collection.
A serializer should never assume that any properties exist.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection"></xref> that contains the properties to serialize.
Sets the name of the specified existing object.

<xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23Serialization%23IDesignerSerializationManager%23SetName(System.Object,System.String)> is useful when you need to create and then name an instance of an object without using <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Serialization.WorkflowMarkupSerializationManager.System%23ComponentModel%23Design%23Serialization%23IDesignerSerializationManager%23CreateInstance(System.Type,System.Collections.ICollection,System.String,System.Boolean)?displayProperty=fullName>.
The object to name.
The name to assign to the object.
